questions.question: What is fundraising in the context of VC funds?

options.text: How you raise your next fund - convincing LPs to commit capital to Fund II after showing results from Fund I

questions.explanation: Fundraising is how you raise your next fund. After you've invested Fund I and shown results, you need to convince LPs to commit capital to Fund II. This involves identifying potential LPs, preparing materials that demonstrate your track record, managing relationships over months of conversations, and closing commitments.

questions.question: What tools do you already have that support fundraising?

options.text: You need to buy all new tools
Fund operations software generates track record materials, CRM tracks LP relationships, sourcing tools can help identify potential LPs

questions.explanation: Most of the infrastructure you need for fundraising already exists in tools you've covered. Fund operations software generates your track record materials. Your CRM tracks LP relationships. Sourcing-type tools can help identify potential LPs. Unlike other parts of the VC tech stack, there's no dominant fundraising-specific platform yet.

questions.question: How can you identify potential LPs?

options.text: Use sourcing tools like PitchBook (has good data on institutional investors) or Specter, similar to how you'd find companies

questions.explanation: Identifying potential LPs is like sourcing, but for LPs instead of companies. You want to identify institutional investors, family offices, high-net-worth individuals, and fund-of-funds that invest in your stage, geography, and strategy. Use the same sourcing tools: PitchBook has good data on institutional investors, Specter can help identify active LPs in your space. If you're interested in specific datasets for LPs, Preqin is more focused on LP data.

questions.question: How should you prepare fundraising materials?

options.text: Build separate systems for fundraising collateral
Export data from your fund operations platform - don't build separate systems, it should come directly from your operations data

questions.explanation: LPs want to see your track record, fund strategy, team backgrounds, and portfolio performance. Your fund operations platform generates performance data and portfolio summaries automatically. Export this into your pitch deck and fundraising materials. Don't build separate systems for fundraising collateral, it should come directly from your operations data.

questions.question: How should you manage the fundraising process?

options.text: Use your CRM to track LP prospects and conversations exactly like deal flow - LPs move through stages (initial contact, meeting, diligence, committed)

questions.explanation: Fundraising takes months. You're talking to dozens of potential LPs at different stages: some in early conversations, others doing diligence, some committed. Use your CRM to track LP prospects and conversations exactly like deal flow. LPs move through stages (initial contact, meeting, diligence, committed). Track what materials they've seen, what questions they've asked, and when you need to follow up.

questions.question: What is the standard tool for data rooms during LP diligence?
questions.explanation: When LPs do diligence, they want access to detailed fund information: legal documents, portfolio details, historical performance, compliance materials. Docsend is the standard. Organize your materials into a clean structure, grant access to LPs as they enter diligence, and track what they're looking at to understand their concerns and interests.

questions.question: What is the key insight about fundraising tools?

options.text: You need to build custom fundraising platforms
Focus on internal tools that help you be more organized, responsive, and prepared - better CRM, better operations software, good data room organization

questions.explanation: The key insight: Focus on internal tools that help you be more organized, responsive, and prepared. Better CRM so you never forget an LP conversation. Better operations software so you can generate track record materials quickly. Good data room organization so LPs can find what they need during diligence. The tools exist - use them well.

questions.question: How can you track which LPs attend which events?

options.text: Track which LPs attend which events, what conferences matter for your stage and geography - some funds maintain spreadsheets, some data providers focus on events like Sourcescrub

questions.explanation: Much of fundraising happens at conferences, LP events, and industry gatherings. Track which LPs attend which events, what conferences matter for your stage and geography, and where you can create in-person touchpoints. Some funds maintain spreadsheets of relevant events with expected LP attendance. There are some data providers focused on events (e.g., Sourcescrub) which can help find the right gatherings for fundraising.

questions.question: What should you focus your engineering time on regarding fundraising?

options.text: Focus on tools that improve your investment process - fundraising happens episodically and is relationship-driven, the tools you already have are sufficient

questions.explanation: Focus your engineering time on tools that improve your investment process (research, deal flow, operations). Fundraising happens episodically (every few years) and is relationship-driven. The tools you already have are sufficient if you use them well.

questions.question: How can Docsend analytics help during fundraising?

options.text: Docsend analytics show you which documents get the most attention, which helps you prepare for LP questions
They only show who accessed the data room

questions.explanation: Docsend analytics show you which documents get the most attention, which helps you prepare for their questions. This is valuable during LP diligence - understanding what LPs are focusing on helps you be more responsive and prepared for their concerns and interests.
